intro: Androsace stricta, commonly known as the upright sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in harsh, alpine environments. Androsace stricta thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
